thread.title: Eagan Residence Inn sold, will change flags
thread.title_full: Eagan Residence Inn sold, will change flags

author: Mark Reilly
title: Eagan Residence Inn sold, will change flags
text:
Eagan Residence Inn sold, will change flags Aug 3, 2015, 7:15am CDT Industries & Tags Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Mark Reilly Managing Editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Home of the Day See All Homes of the Day The Eagan Residence Inn will become a Sonesta ES as part of an $11.5 million deal. Finance & Commerce reports that an affiliate of Hospitality Properties Trust in Newton, Mass., bought the 120-unit hotel from Goldman Sachs. The new buyer also owns Sonesta International Hotels and will convert the property to Sonesta's extended-stay brand. The hotel, which opened in 1988, was sold in 1994 for $9.25 million. Officials at Hospitality Properties Trust couldn't immediately be reached for comment. 
Want Minneapolis / St. Paul Travel   Home of the Day
